list_definition.definition: the act of remembering or reminding

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a statue erected in remembrance of the dead.

list_ex_of_english: Let me say this from my remembrance of it, it does not bear upon the situation in which we now find ourselves.
We have heard quite a few fond remembrances about incomes policies in the past, and that has all been relevant.
The development of socialism in the 1860s distorted remembrance of the earlier years.
Coming to the present day, after the interesting remembrances of things past.
How to close a woefully incomplete remembrance of such a superb scholar and human being?
His domestic virtues were truly exemplary and while they served to endear the remembrances they embitter the loss of him to all his numerous friends and connexions.
I should think that there would be no very affectionate remembrances among those who have been brought up in a house of this sort.
The list archive need not be limited to remembrance of messages past.
